comment.author: 92602305@N04
comment._content:
This series of Koolberin photos is quite thought provoking.  

From the farmer's perspective, one can admire the enormous effort to clear the land and make a viable farm from scratch, with all the risks involved.  These people were made of tough stuff.

From an ecological perspective, to all but obliterate a unique landscape which has evolved over eons with its rich diversity and replace it with a monoculture, is enough to make you weep, especially on the scale this has occurred over vast areas of Western Australia's south west.  The rare 'nature reserve' remnants that survive today leave a sad reminder.
